fact: The first 1GB hard drive, introduced by IBM in 1980, weighed over 500 pounds and cost $40,000.

The Great Pyramid of Giza was the tallest man-made structure in the world for over 3,800 years.
Julius Caesar was kidnapped by pirates in 75 BCE and demanded a higher ransom for himself because he believed he was worth more.
Water covers about 71% of the Earth's surface.
Honey never spoils; archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and still edible.
The longest-running TV show in the U.S. is 'The Simpsons,' which began airing in 1989.
The Academy Awards, also known as the Oscars, have been held annually since 1929.
The average person spends about 2 hours and 31 minutes on social media every day.
The concept of 'retirement' as we know it today was popularized in the early 20th century with the introduction of Social Security in the U.S.
Regular physical activity can improve mental health by reducing symptoms of depression and anxiety.
The human body has 206 bones, which are all connected by joints.
The global debt reached a record $300 trillion in 2021.
In 2021, the most valuable company in the world was Apple, with a market capitalization of over $2 trillion.
The first news broadcast on television in the U.S. was on July 1, 1941.
The term 'fake news' became prominent during the 2016 U.S. Presidential Election.
